benchmark_details.name: VISTA: A Visual and Textual Attention Dataset for Interpreting Multimodal Models
benchmark_details.overview: VISTA is a human-annotated visual and textual attention dataset designed to enhance the interpretability of Vision-Language Models (VLMs) by aligning eye-tracking data with textual descriptions to understand how humans associate visual regions with corresponding text segments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To explore and enhance the interpretability of Vision-Language Models through human-annotated visual and textual attention data.

data.source: Data collected through eye-tracking with participants describing images while their attention was recorded.
data.annotation: Manual annotation with eye-tracking data collection.

methods: Use of NCC (Normalized Cross-Correlation) and AUC (Area Under Curve) metrics
methodology.calculation: NCC calculates correlation between the eye-tracking map and generated saliency map; AUC measures how well the saliency map distinguishes between human fixations and other areas.
methodology.interpretation: Higher NCC and AUC scores indicate better alignment with human visual attention.
methodology.validation: Bootstrapping technique to estimate stability across iterations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participants' audio recordings were deleted to ensure de-identification.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from participants before data collection.
